On Laura Loomer

Loomer’s act of handcuffing herself to Twitter HQ in response to her being banned, taken without context, is an admirable act.

But like all acts, it must be taken in context.

She cheered or was silent when pro-whites were banned from Twitter, and regularly hides behind being a Jew in order to play the victim.  In her first Gab post since being banned from Twitter, she mentioned her Jewish heritage three times.  So she is fine with her enemies being deplatformed, and she only became dedicated to freedom of speech once it affected her.

Now she’s set up a GoFundMe to raise money, instead of producing content she can sell, like a book.  If she were confident in her legal case, she could sue and Big Tech would pay damages.  But she isn’t going to win her case, and she probably won’t even take it to court.  She is going to raise tens of thousands, hire a Jewish lawyer friend who is going to advise her “don’t bother, their TOS says they can ban anyone for any reason”. And then she is going to pocket your money.

I hope I’m wrong, and she is a champion for free speech.  I really hope I am.  But I have every reason to be skeptical of self-serving Jews crying victim, and you should be skeptical, too.

Seeing that I am an actual scientist, I have a pretty good idea that's how science works. LOL and you have put forth a strawman because nobody is arguing that every member of x or y group is a criminal.

I am quite certain there are people on death row who are actually innocent so you can't even say all death row inmates are murderers.

But the mere fact that you cannot apply a group average to every individual in the group does not mean that the group average has no value.

I am sure that some people who are registered sex offenders are actually innocent. Yet as a society, because of the group average, such people are not allowed to work in jobs dealing with children. Only a fool would go out of her way to hire registered sex offenders as babysitters simply because the stereotype does not apply to every single individual every single time.

What you are essentially saying is that patterns do not exist. But a core function of human intelligence is the recognition of those patterns.

I can understand your resistance to the idea of groups. Because our highest American traditions deal with people as individuals when it comes to their rights. People have an individual right to keep and bear arms, and they have an individual right to freedom of religion. They have an individual right to objective Justice. And that is as it should be for American citizens.

A person accused of raping and murdering a child is just as innocent until proven guilty Beyond a reasonable doubt no matter which group that person might belong to.

But that does not mean that group averages do not matter. They matter a great deal and they have a huge social impact.  To ignore these differences and to deny the existence of those patterns is to pervert a fundamental portion of human intelligence in pattern recognition. If one person here or there does that it is not a big deal, but if the willful denial of patterns in reality is widespread, the result is suicidal.

I explained already how we know smoking to be dangerous in spite of the fact that many individuals smoke without apparent harm . We did that by comparing group averages rather than comparing individuals. that is how we have discovered the harmful effects of quite a few things. If we weren't willing to do that, we still would not know that many of these things are harmful. And we also would not know the sexual offenders have a high chance of reoffending, which is why sex offender registries were invented.

I haven't come across anything that raises any real red flags that "Handsome Truth" has any nefarious intentions. He seems like a genuine goy who just wants to get others to name the jew in a different way.  I personally like what they're doing, but I understand that it's not for everyone. I'm a big proponent of, "Stay in Your Lane Nationalism", so I believe people should go out and do what they think works best to expose the nose, while allowing others to do the same thing without interfering with each other.

At the end of the day we all have a common enemy, as well as a common goal, so I'm not going to get bogged down fighting over differences in tactics, opinions, personalities, lifestyle choices, or what people did before they started noticing the nose and waking up to the JQ (as long as it isn't some crazy pedo shit, or anything too extreme).

We all come from different backgrounds and have different personalities that can potentially clash with each other, but that's not a valid enough reason to undermine one another and create unnecessary schisms between us. We all don't have to be best friends in order to work towards accomplishing a shared objective. Keep in mind that many of us were victims of the brainwashing which led us to making stupid decisions and acting differently before finally getting red pilled. There's also not one standard approach to take when trying to wake others up to the JQ. It's different strokes for different folks.

My way isn't going to work with everyone, and neither is yours, or "Handsome Truth", and that's fine because it's going to take a multifaceted approach in order to reach as many people as we can. We don't have the luxury of waiting for the perfect person who checks all the correct boxes to come along and spread the message. We all have our flaws and we all have our strengths, so we should focus more on what we all do well instead of pointing fingers at each other and slinging insults while making unfounded claims about people being infiltrators. 

With that being said, it's definitely good to be wary of others because movements like ours get infiltrated all the time, but I don't see the point of  people sowing seeds of distrust without any solid evidence to support their suspicions.
